GameItemType.Description: A gift from the queen, this necklace the wearer's heal rate.
This bone charm increases the wearer's heal rate.
This bronze dagger is dull and worn but can still bite.

After the sacrifice of Red Spring, as the butchermen still writhed upon their altars, Amhah called to Curgen. The titan never responded, the ritual was uncomplete. Realizing his spell would never end Amhah turned his sword on himself, but it was to late. He is trapped by it as well.

GameModifier.Provides: +30% cumulative damage with each successful attack

GameItemType.Description: A crude short sword.
Spun by the weavers of Grennhelm; intended for pilgrims unaccustomed to the cold of the north.
Flatbread baked from the rare Cavan mushroom - providing both nourishment and healing to weary pilgrims.
The Padars of old were often forced to defend themselves from fearful, suspicious villagers. The staff was their weapon of choice.
A protective helmet, fashioned after those worn by the Dunnadar, Grennhelm's protectors.
An enchanted ring - one imbued with the power of the Elemental Lord himself. It grants the wearer increased attacking ability in combat.
A great mace, marked with the image of the staff and the sword - the seal of the Dunnadar.
Behind a partially crumbled wall, you find a flask containing a healing potion.
A rare find - a mostly intact copy of this highly-prized manual of fighting techniques.
Such is this weapons craftsmanship that it remains as flexible and strong as the day it was carved.
Hidden in an abandoned hut, you find these enchanted gauntlets.
Here stand the still-flaming remains of Uzangii, northernmost settlement of the Drota people.
A pouch containing medicinal herbs favored by Drota healers.
A fine shield, bearing the image of the staff and the sword, enchanted to radiate heat.
A potion which grants whoever drinks it a portion of the Elemental Lord's speed and ability to strike quickly in combat.
An ancient scroll - one that grants increased dexterity to whomsoever masters the prayers written upon it.
One of the Veladrii took this expertly-crafted weapon to the grave with him. Take it for your own now.
One of the Veladrii took this expertly-crafted weapon to the grave with him. Take it for your own now.

GameModifier.Provides: Victims are shrunk, halving their Attack and giving them +50% to Dodge

GameItemType.Description: One of the Veladrii took this expertly-crafted weapon to the grave with him. Take it for your own now.

GameModifier.Provides: Backswing- If the attack misses the unit gets a second attack against the same target

GameItemType.Description: A talisman granting the bearer the gift of increased sight.
A weapon to strike fear in the hearts of mortal and immortal alike; its razor sharp edge generates a cutting cold as intense as a blade.
Armor of surpassing quality, engraved with the staff and the sword - the seal of the Dunnadar, Padar Janos's companions. Take these for your own.
Armor of surpassing quality, engraved with the staff and the sword - the seal of the Dunnadar, Padar Janos's companions. Take these for your own.
A cloak granting the wearer additional protection from enchantments of all types.
An army of golems once protected Annerys's shrine; this ancient weapon belonged to one of them.
The same cataclysm that toppled the city walls has exposed a hidden chamber, containing this powerful artifact.
An ancient talisman; a boon to any who enter combat wearing it.
An enchanted potion; whomsoever drinks of it will be gifted with great speed, similar to that breed of Sions known as Edars.
A fearsome weapon, favored by the Fallen for many training drills.
Pry this fine weapon from the grasp of the skeleton that holds it.

GameModifier.Provides: Does 10 fire damage (+5 per death and fire shard) to target unit. If the unit is killed an inferno is left in their tile
